dublin_core.dcvalue: The purpose of the study was 1 to identify the requirements for syndromic disease surveillance and epidemiology systems arising from events such as the SARS outbreak in March 2003 and the deliberate spread of Bacillus anthracis or anthrax in the US in 2001 and 2 to use these specifications as input to the construction of a system intended to meet these requirements An important goal was to provide information about the diffusion of a communicable disease without being dependent on centralised storage of information about individual patients or revealing patient identifiable information
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-10T17:32:05Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2007-03-05
Propagation of program control: a tool for distributed disease surveillance.
